benchmark_details.name: CONFER
benchmark_details.overview: CONFER is a dataset specifically designed to evaluate how Natural Language Inference (NLI) models process inference in conditional sentences, particularly focusing on presuppositional reasoning.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess the performance of NLI models in understanding presupposition projection in conditional sentences.

data.source: Semi-automatically generated using linguist-designed templates and GPT-3.5 for sentence formation.
data.annotation: Manually annotated with NLI labels (Entailment, Contradiction, Neutral) by a linguist and double-annotated for reliability.

methods: Evaluation of NLI models through various prompting techniques
methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on performance on the dataset comparing the output of NLI models.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy and F1 scores indicate better model understanding of presuppositional reasoning.
methodology.validation: Performance evaluation compared across several models trained on different datasets.
